sourceMeaningMnemonic: You have a special <radical>thread</radical> in your <radical>towel</radical> you can use to make it <radical>stand</radical> up by <kanji>tighten</kanji>ing it.
meaningInfo: Imagine pulling this thread and watch as your towel tightens and goes rigid, standing up almost completely on its own (except that the thread did it).
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>tighten</kanji> your towel before you eat <reading>ta</reading>ter (<ja>てい</ja>) tots every night. That way it stands up nice and straight next to your eating chair, ready for all that delicious tater tot grease that gets on your fingers.
readingInfo: A tightened towel stands up for easy grease cleanup. No wiping on your pants, no dripping on the floor.
